summary: This bill, the District of Columbia Federal Immigration Compliance Act, mandates that the District of Columbia adhere to federal immigration laws. It prohibits DC from having laws, policies, or practices that prevent officials from sharing immigration status information or cooperating with federal requests from the Department of Homeland Security, primarily regarding detainers. An exception is made to protect individuals coming forward as crime victims or witnesses, preventing the sharing of information or compliance with detainers in these cases.
